com.persistit

Class Management.BufferPoolInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.persistit.Management.AcquisitionTimeBase
      • com.persistit.Management.BufferPoolInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Enclosing interface:
    Management

    public static class Management.BufferPoolInfo
extends Management.AcquisitionTimeBase
implements Serializable
    Exposes information about a BufferPool. A BufferPool is a container for all the buffers of a particular size. The Management.getBufferPoolInfoArray() method returns an array containing BufferPoolInfo elements for each buffer size.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getBufferSize

        public int getBufferSize()
        Return the size of Buffers managed by this pool.
        Returns:
        The size in bytes of each buffer in this pool

      • getBufferCount

        public int getBufferCount()
        Return the count of Buffers managed by this pool.
        Returns:
        The count

      • getMissCount

        public long getMissCount()
        Return the count of lookup operations for pages images in this pool. This number, in comparison with the hit counter, indicates how effective the cache is in reducing disk I/O.
        Returns:
        The get count

      • getHitCount

        public long getHitCount()
        Return the count of lookup operations for pages images in this pool for which the page image was already found in this BufferPool. This number, in comparison with the miss counter, indicates how effective the cache is in reducing disk I/O.
        Returns:
        The hit count

      • getNewCount

        public long getNewCount()
        Return the count of newly create pages images in this Pool. A new page is one that does not need to be read from disk.
        Returns:
        The new page counter

      • getEvictCount

        public long getEvictCount()
        Return the count of valid pages evicted from this pool.
        Returns:
        The evicted page count

      • getWriteCount

        public long getWriteCount()
        Return count of pages written from this pool.
        Returns:
        The forced write count

      • getForcedWriteCount

        public long getForcedWriteCount()
        Return count of pages forced to be written when dirty on eviction
        Returns:
        The forced write count

      • getForcedCheckpointWriteCount

        public long getForcedCheckpointWriteCount()
        Return count of pages forced to be written due to an updated after a checkpoint
        Returns:
        The forced checkpoint write count

      • getHitRatio

        public double getHitRatio()
        Get the "hit ratio" - the number of hits divided by the number of overall gets. A value close to 1.0 indicates that most attempts to find data in the BufferPool are successful - i.e., that the cache is effectively reducing the need for disk read operations.
        Returns:
        The ratio

      • getValidPageCount

        public int getValidPageCount()
        Get the count of valid pages in this pool.
        Returns:
        The count of valid pages in this pool

      • getDirtyPageCount

        public int getDirtyPageCount()
        Get the count of dirty pages (pages that contain updates not yet written to disk) in this pool.
        Returns:
        The count of dirty pages in this pool

      • getReaderClaimedPageCount

        public int getReaderClaimedPageCount()
        Get the count of pages on which running threads have reader (non-exclusive), but not writer (exclusive) claims in this pool.
        Returns:
        The count of pages with reader claims

      • getWriterClaimedPageCount

        public int getWriterClaimedPageCount()
        Get the count of pages on which running threads have writer (exclusive) claims in this pool.
        Returns:
        The count of pages with writer claims

      • getEarliestDirtyTimestamp

        public long getEarliestDirtyTimestamp()
        Returns:
        Earliest timestamp of any dirty page in this BufferPool
